flowRoot.flowPara: a) All of the molecule rest frames, ie the frames where any of the molecules are at rest, including when the molecule is at rest. Refered to as Molecular rest frame

b)Molecule moving in the same direction as laser beam. Here the frequency of the photon required for absorption has to be shifted higher since in its rest frame, shown in a), the frequency of the photon is higher
c)Molecule moving in opposite direction of laser beam direction
Here, the opposite case for the shift occurs. The absorbing photon must be of lower frequency since in the molecular rest frame, the frequency will appear higher
